intro: Psychotria stenantha, commonly known as the narrow-leaved Psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in shaded, humid environments. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. Psychotria stenantha is often found in lowland rainforests and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value. Its flowers attract various pollinators, contributing to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
